triage.rationale: Blood in sputum and chest pain are red flags for pulmonary embolism. This is an emergency situation that requires immediate medical attention.
triage.recommended_action: Emergency department visit or call 911 immediately
triage.care_instructions: If you are experiencing chest pain, shortness of breath, or difficulty speaking, call 911 immediately. If you have a pulmonary embolism, you will need to be treated with anticoagulant medications and possibly thrombectomy (a procedure to remove the clot).

action.action_type: Emergency department visit or call 911 immediately
tasks: If symptoms worsen, seek medical help promptly.
This information is not medical advice. Seek professional help if uncertain.
